snippet: Though the number of people working while retired has risen in 20 years, more people give up on the idea, largely because of the difficulty in finding a suitable job.
abstract: Nearly three-fourths of Americans say they will continue working after retiring from their main job, but only 18.9 percent of Americans age 65 or older actually remain in the work force; one of the main reasons for the disconnect is that many people give up on the idea of working after retiring because of the difficulty of finding a suitable job.
lead_paragraph: Though the number of people working while retired has risen in 20 years, more people give up on the idea, largely because of the difficulty in finding a suitable job.
